column4: Is beryl a window manager or a desktop environment?  Will feisty still use GNOME?
How do you propose to run two window managers at the same time, exactly?
Good point.  I'm still a little hazy on the exact definition of a window manager.

Window manager draws the titlebar at the top (with the _ o x) buttons. Window managers decide where windows are. Window managers move, maximise, minimise, restore, scale, tile, animate windows. Manage them, if you will.
Desktop environments provide a consistent user interface, configuration utilities, a desktop, an API, and applications. An environment, if you will, to work in. Upon a desktop.
*in a fake sneaky tone* But you can't run a window manager *under another window manager*?
Any desktop environment can be used with any window manager, and vice versa.
*gravely* No. But the best minds of the nation are working at it.
I sense that you've had the opportunity to make that distinction before ;p
let me see if I've got this straight.  Your mount points are now okay, but something crashed and now the display doesn't work?
I believe you're talking to awilcox
No, but if no perl gurus show up I can do it in python.
Well, at need I could do it in java. I was kind of looking for something like cat file | somemagicalcommandwitharcanename
Yeah, can't really help you with that.  Bet I can do it in fewer lines than with java though. ;\
Oh xD Sorry, brainfart. while read line ; do if [ $a = "1" ]  ; a = 0 ; break ; else echo $line ; a = 1 ; fi ; done
That would look so much more cryptic in perl.
